compliant.section: This Privacy Policy defines "Personal Information" as any information relating to an identified or identifiable individual.
compliant.legal provisions: Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.

compliant.section: Examples of Personal Information we collect include your name, address, telephone number, and online identifiers like cookies and IP addresses.
compliant.legal provisions: Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.

non_compliant.section: The definition of Personal Information includes information which does not identify you on its own but that we link to you.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.
non_compliant.amend: While linking data to make it identifiable can fall under GDPR, the policy should be more specific about the types of data linked and the purposes for such linkage. Consider adding language about 'pseudonymous data' and conditions for processing such data in accordance with GDPR.
